Dialogue.Page: Welcome to the party! I'm Samster68. It's nice to meet you! I am an Outer Wilds modder and YouTuber.
I'm so happy that Evacuation scored so well in the New Horizons Mod Jam!
Anything on your mind?

DialogueOption.Text: What else have you worked on?
How can I contact you or find your content?
What is your favorite Geometric Theorem?
Can you give me a hint about your upcoming story mod?

Dialogue.Page: I first played Outer Wilds in 2019, and instantly fell in love with the game. I have since introduced it to many of my closest friends.

I discovered the modding community in early 2022 and messed around with an earlier version of New Horizons to understand how it worked. I knew I wanted to make my own story mod after playing <color=orange>The Vision</color> (by hearth1an) and worked on it for a month straight.
The end result was <color=orange>Fret's Quest</color>, a mod where you also help a Nomai recover a powerful artifact. It also features a giant...
...well you know what it is if you've played it.

Then I teamed up with 2walker2 and Texture_Turtle in 2023 for the New Horzions Mod Jam. We created <color=orange>Evacuation</color>, a look at what would happen if the Hearthains had to leave their home solar system.

I really got busy in 2024, where I started my own YouTube channel centered around Outer Wilds modding. Every month I create a recap video going over what cool projects the community has been working on!
In late 2024 I released a smaller mod called <color=orange>Hearthian Golf</color>. I've heard rumors that people have played it.
Finally, in 2025 I was asked to be a judge in the Mini Star Systems Jam!
And now you're pretty much caught up!
I'm currently still running the YouTube channel and am working on a <color=orange>new story mod</color>.
You can contact me on the Outer Wilds Modding Discord Server as <color=orange>Samster68</color>. You can also find me on YouTube under the name <color=orange>Half a Man Videos</color>.
What an interesting and unique question!

I'm a big fan of the <color=orange>Triangle Inequality Theorem</color>. It states that for any triangle, the sum of the lengths of any two sides must be greater than or equal to the length of the remaining side.
It so easily explains how our brains calculate the shortest route between two points.
I'm not sure how you're going to put that in your ship log.
<color=orange>GENERATION</color>. That's all I can say.
Bye! Enjoy the party!
